sentence.text: We noted that Sirtuin 1 (negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II) is overexpressed in HPV-infected cervical cancer cells and hypothesized that SIRT1 counteracts antiviral immunity.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: In conclusion, SIRT1 enabled HPV-infected cervical cancer cells to continue growing by nullifying activation of innate immune response inflammasome-mediated immunity.
Without SIRT1, cervical cancer cells could no longer survive because of the derepression of the activation of innate immune response inflammasome.

Furthermore, the growth of cervical cancer xenografts was significantly inhibited by either negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II-targeting siRNAs or SIRT1-knockdown-derived extracellular vesicles.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
